text: Agdistis caradjai is a moth in the family Pterophoridae. It is known from Turkey, Russia and Iran.A new species, a new synonym, and new distribution records in the genus Agdistis Hübner, 1825 from Iran (Pterophoridae: Agdistinae) The wingspan is about 23 mm. The head smoothly is scaled and grey-brown. The thorax and abdomen are greyish brown and the forewings have a grey-brown ground colour. ==References== Category:Agdistinae Category:Moths of Turkey Category:Moths of Russia Category:Moths described in 1975
title: Agdistis caradjai
